channel.title: This may be a question, about Global Warming
channel.description:
So, there is global warming. Is there something as global colding? Because I live in Chicago and it feels like it gets colder winters every year :3
Please move this to the right section if its notright.

item.title: This may be a question, about Global Warming
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Svitkona:

Global warming is not real the only truth is Allah and may peace be Upon you.

lmfao

item.title: This may be a question, about Global Warming
item.dc:creator: @AliAbid AliAbid
item.description:
@AliAbid wrote:

[quote=“Techkid, post:45, topic:537280”][quote author=jme link=topic=656098.msg4392685#msg4392685 date=1388099365]

Wiki can be tampered with by anyone! the only reason google is my friend is because it shows sites for research not tampered information. They only review all studies of info every 2 Years!

This is true, but most of the information is cited, and you are free to check the sources for yourself.

And if you go edit a Wikipedia page with nonsense, it’s going to be removed in about 60 seconds.
[/quote]
But your never sure if the cited sources are true information.[/quote]

The sources are on the bottom of the page, you can just click em and check them out

Read full topic

item.title: This may be a question, about Global Warming
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“AliAbid, post:38, topic:537280”][quote author=Techkid link=topic=656098.msg4392121#msg4392121 date=1387897470]
Global warming causes harsher winters. :palm: nuff said
[/quote]

If it does, how?[/quote]Think about it. Global warming increases the amount of liquid water in the hydrosphere. With increases of water, comes increases of weather. It doesn’t all just stay liquid. It condensates and precipitates too.

item.title: This may be a question, about Global Warming
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Zombie Juice, post:27, topic:537280”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=656098.msg4391193#msg4391193 date=1387583685]

Global warming does not exist. Don’t believe everything the government tell you.

you don’t know if it exists or not, stfu.

Lmao. Do you pay your green taxes like a good little boy then? Do you sort your aluminium cans from your crisp packets? The Earth is changing naturally. It has been proven that we have had little to no impact since the 90s. Don’t just assert what I know just because you have little to no clue.

Okay. Where’s your proof that it doesn’t exist?

You want proof, go and find it. I have already found proof. Google it and find a source you trust. You are clueless if you think that global warming is absolutely because of mankind. You can’t comprehend obviously that you just so happen to be born in an era where the natural weather cycle of the Earth is due for change anyway. We are due for a new ice age about now, we are due for a killer asteroid about now. Is it our fault that the Earth would be hit by a killer asteroid if it did? Just because on average they happen every now and then, and one is already overdue? Society is peril. Go live in a cave.
[/quote]You are the clear definition of an idiot. There is more than enough proof that global warming is caused by man. Want to know why, apparently your sources didn’t tell you why. The pollution that comes out of cars, factories, powerplants, etc all carry “Green house gases” and another poisonous molecule called carcinogens. Carcinogens also have an effect of causing cancer in the human body too, as well as they reflect back up, which in turn gets trapped in our higher atmosphere by the green house gases.

A lot of other idiots that would be siding with you right now would be saying its part of an 11 year sun cycle where the poles of the sun flip, blah blah blah. First of all, yet its true that the sun does has a cycle that consists of 11 years where 5.5 years into the cycle the sun is at its hottest temperature, but that wouldn’t effect us if we had the green house effect going on in our atmosphere. We always had the effect going, which is what caused the last ice ages to end.

Please don’t bring half assed examples to your argument if you can’t even argue the outcome of it. There is no “Earth is overdue for an asteroid” or “Earth is overdue for another ice age.” All in turn, it depends mostly on whats going on outside of our atmosphere that will determine when the next ice age will come (unless its a super volcano eruption).

just shut up.

kthx

/endrant

@asshole_rule too

who said the sun’s 11 year cycle had anything to do with this? that is to do specifically with the sun’s solar flares due to the magnetic field. this does have some effect on the weather on earth but the earth has natural cycles, ice ages to tropical weathers worldwide. all we are seeing is the beginnings of a new ice age, not global warming due to cars and industrial activity. they are insignificant. you obviously read the newspapers for your scientific resources. you are not stupid but you are ignorant.

you instigated this by quoting me for the record. you are the fgts.[/quote]You say to google this topic and find the sources we trust. Sorry, but Fox news isn’t a trustful source to me. You’re the epitome of stupidity.

Read full topic

Global warming does not exist. Don’t believe everything the government tell you.

you don’t know if it exists or not, stfu.

Lmao. Do you pay your green taxes like a good little boy then? Do you sort your aluminium cans from your crisp packets? The Earth is changing naturally. It has been proven that we have had little to no impact since the 90s. Don’t just assert what I know just because you have little to no clue.

Okay. Where’s your proof that it doesn’t exist?

You want proof, go and find it. I have already found proof. Google it and find a source you trust. You are clueless if you think that global warming is absolutely because of mankind. You can’t comprehend obviously that you just so happen to be born in an era where the natural weather cycle of the Earth is due for change anyway. We are due for a new ice age about now, we are due for a killer asteroid about now. Is it our fault that the Earth would be hit by a killer asteroid if it did? Just because on average they happen every now and then, and one is already overdue? Society is peril. Go live in a cave.
[/quote]You are the clear definition of an idiot. There is more than enough proof that global warming is caused by man. Want to know why, apparently your sources didn’t tell you why. The pollution that comes out of cars, factories, powerplants, etc all carry “Green house gases” and another poisonous molecule called carcinogens. Carcinogens also have an effect of causing cancer in the human body too, as well as they reflect back up, which in turn gets trapped in our higher atmosphere by the green house gases.

A lot of other idiots that would be siding with you right now would be saying its part of an 11 year sun cycle where the poles of the sun flip, blah blah blah. First of all, yet its true that the sun does has a cycle that consists of 11 years where 5.5 years into the cycle the sun is at its hottest temperature, but that wouldn’t effect us if we had the green house effect going on in our atmosphere. We always had the effect going, which is what caused the last ice ages to end.

Please don’t bring half assed examples to your argument if you can’t even argue the outcome of it. There is no “Earth is overdue for an asteroid” or “Earth is overdue for another ice age.” All in turn, it depends mostly on whats going on outside of our atmosphere that will determine when the next ice age will come (unless its a super volcano eruption).

just shut up.

kthx

/endrant[/quote]
@asshole_rule too

who said the sun’s 11 year cycle had anything to do with this? that is to do specifically with the sun’s solar flares due to the magnetic field. this does have some effect on the weather on earth but the earth has natural cycles, ice ages to tropical weathers worldwide. all we are seeing is the beginnings of a new ice age, not global warming due to cars and industrial activity. they are insignificant. you obviously read the newspapers for your scientific resources. you are not stupid but you are ignorant.

you instigated this by quoting me for the record. you are the fgts.

item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Zombie Juice, post:15, topic:537280”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=656098.msg4391004#msg4391004 date=1387505506]

Global warming does not exist. Don’t believe everything the government tell you.

you don’t know if it exists or not, stfu.
[/quote]
Lmao. Do you pay your green taxes like a good little boy then? Do you sort your aluminium cans from your crisp packets? The Earth is changing naturally. It has been proven that we have had little to no impact since the 90s. Don’t just assert what I know just because you have little to no clue.[/quote]

  1. I don’t pay taxes.
  2. i don’t know what a crisp packet is.
  3. the earth is changing naturally? WOW you don’t say…
  4. shut up with your bullshit, any conclusions made about global warming have been inconsistent, so you can’t really say if it exists or doesn’t.
  5. i wasn’t asserting what you know, I was asserting what you don’t know. (E.G - anything)

You can’t comprehend obviously that you just so happen to be born in an era where the natural weather cycle of the Earth is due for change anyway. Just because on average they happen every now and then, and one is already overdue? Society is peril. Go live in a cave.[/quote]You are the clear definition of an idiot. The pollution that comes out of cars, factories, powerplants, etc all carry “Green house gases” and another poisonous molecule called carcinogens. We always had the effect going, which is what caused the last ice ages to end.

There is no “Earth is overdue for an asteroid” or “Earth is overdue for another ice age.” All in turn, it depends mostly on whats going on outside of our atmosphere that will determine when the next ice age will come (unless its a super volcano eruption).
